sen.j: 田辺 福麻呂（たなべ の さきまろ、生没年不詳）は、奈良時代の万葉歌人。
sen.e: TANABE no Sakimaro (dates of birth and death unknown) was a contributor to Manyoshu in the Nara Period.
TANABE no Sakimaro (dates of birth and death unknown) was a contributor to Manyoshu during the Nara Period.
TANABE no Sakimaro (year of birth and death unknown) was a contributor to Manyoshu during the Nara Period.
His kabane (hereditary title) was Fuhito.
His kabane (hereditary title) was Fuhito.
His kabane (hereditary title) was Fuhito.

sen.j: 出自については不明である。
sen.e: His status by birth is unknown.
His status by birth is unknown.
His status by birth is unknown.

sen.j: 「万葉集」に44首が収められている。
sen.e: He contributed 44 poems to "Manyoshu" (the oldest anthology of tanka).
He contributed 44 poems to "Manyoshu" (the oldest anthology of tanka).
He contributed 44 poems to 'Manyoshu' (the oldest anthology of tanka).

sen.j: 巻18に短歌13首があり、巻6・巻9にある長歌10首とその反歌21首は「田辺福麻呂の歌集に出づ」とある。
sen.e: 13 Tanka (thirty-one syllables' poem) are found in Volume 18; ten Choka (long poem) and their 21 Hanka (tanka appendage to a choka) in Volumes 6 and 9 are indicated that they "appear in Book of poetry of TANABE no Sakimaro."

13 Tanka (thirty-one syllable poems) are found in Volume 18; ten Choka (long poem) and their 21 Hanka (tanka appendage to a choka) in Volumes 6 and 9 are indicated that they "appear in a Book of poetry by TANABE no Sakimaro."

13 Tanka (thirty-one syllable poems) are found in Volume 18; ten Choka (long poem) and their 21 Hanka (tanka appendage to a choka) in Volumes 6 and 9 are indicated that they 'appear in a Book of poetry by TANABE no Sakimaro.'

sen.j: それらの歌は、用字・作風などから福麻呂の作と見られている。
sen.e: These poems are regarded as Sakimaro's works based on the choice of word and style of poetry.
These poems are regarded as Sakimaro's works based on the word choice and style of poetry.
These poems are regarded as Sakimaro's works based on the word choice and style of poetry.

sen.j: 748年（天平20年）橘諸兄の使者として越中守大伴家持のところを訪れている。
sen.e: In 748 he visited Ecchu no kami (Governor of Ecchu Province) OTOMO no Yakamochi as a messenger of TACHIBANA no Moroe.
In 748 he visited Ecchu no kami (Governor of Ecchu Province) OTOMO no Yakamochi as a messenger for TACHIBANA no Moroe.
In 748 he visited Ecchu no kami (Governor of Ecchu Province) OTOMO no Yakamochi as a messenger for TACHIBANA no Moroe.
